summary: Completed comprehensive testing of new Nexus Command features: Alerts page, Alert Rules, SMTP configuration, SSH Terminal, and RDP integration. All features are fully functional. Fixed one bug in alert-rules POST endpoint (MongoDB ObjectId serialization).
passed_tests: Dashboard page loading with server overview
Alerts page displays active alerts with severity stats
Alert Rules modal opens and shows default rules
Alert Rules CRUD operations (create, update, delete)
Settings page shows SMTP configuration for admin
SSH button visible on Linux server detail page
SSH Terminal modal opens with credential form
SSH connect endpoint works for Linux servers
SSH correctly rejected for Windows servers
RDP button visible on Windows server detail page
RDP file generation for Windows servers
RDP correctly rejected for Linux servers
critical_code_review_comments: Fixed: MongoDB ObjectId serialization bug in POST /api/alert-rules endpoint - was returning raw _id field which is not JSON serializable
updated_files: /app/backend/server.py - Fixed create_alert_rule endpoint to properly serialize response
seed_data_creation: Test alert rules created and cleaned up during testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: All new features (Alerts, SMTP, SSH Terminal, RDP) are fully functional. The app uses German UI text. SSH Terminal requires real server credentials to test actual connection - UI and API endpoints work correctly. SMTP test email will fail without real SMTP server configured.

alerts_page.details: Alerts page accessible via sidebar, shows alert stats (Total Active, Critical, Warning, Info), displays recent alerts with acknowledge/resolve actions

alert_rules.details: Alert Rules modal opens from Alerts page, shows 3 default rules (High CPU, High Memory, Disk Space Critical), CRUD operations work

smtp_configuration.details: Settings page shows SMTP configuration section for admin users, Save button persists config to MongoDB, Test email endpoint accessible

ssh_terminal.details: SSH button visible on Linux server detail pages, opens terminal modal with credential form (username/password), connect endpoint works

rdp_integration.details: RDP button visible on Windows server detail pages, generates .rdp file for download
